distribution.text: Copyright Â© Red Hat, Inc. All rights reserved.

notes.text: Updated packages that provide Red Hat JBoss Enterprise Application Platform 6.4.1 and fix several bugs, and add various enhancements are now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Red Hat JBoss Enterprise Application Platform 6 is a platform for Java
applications based on JBoss Application Server 7. 

This release updates and replaces Red Hat JBoss Enterprise Application
Platform 6.4 and includes both bug fixes and enhancements. Documentation
for these changes is in the Red Hat JBoss Enterprise Application Platform
6.4.1 Release Notes, linked to in the References. 

All users of Red Hat JBoss Enterprise Application Platform 6.4 on Red Hat
Enterprise Linux 6 are advised to upgrade to these updated packages. The
JBoss server process must be restarted for the update to take effect.
notes.title: Details

notes.text: AdvancedLdapLodinMogule in Red Hat JBoss Enterprise Application Platform (EAP) before 6.4.1 allows attackers to obtain sensitive information via vectors involving logging the LDAP bind credential password when TRACE logging is enabled.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: CVE-2015-1849 JBoss EAP: LDAP bind password is being logged with TRACE log level
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
Before applying this update, make sure all previously-released errata
relevant to your system have been applied.

This update is available via Red Hat Network. Details on how to use Red
Hat Network to apply this update are available at
https://access.redhat.com/knowledge/articles/11258.

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2015-1849 JBoss EAP: LDAP bind password is being logged with TRACE log level
